174.article_body: After a caller allegedly threatened to kidnap an Uttarakhand doctor's son and demanded ₹3 crore as ransom, police said they found the caller to be a 10-year-old YouTuber in Uttar Pradesh's Hapur. The police have arrested the boy and his father after putting their phone on electronic surveillance. A police team was also reportedly deployed outside the doctor's hospital.

175.title: Delhivery IPO subscribed 23% on Day 2, retail portion booked 40%
175.article_body: Delhivery's IPO, worth ₹5,235 crore, was subscribed to 23% by the end of Day 2 on Thursday, a 2% above its Day 1 subscription tally. The retail portion saw the highest subscription at 40%, followed by the qualified institutional investors portion at 29%. Meanwhile, the non-institutional buyers portion remained unchanged at 1% subscription.

176.title: Sanctions on Russia won't affect global oil supply: IEA
176.article_body: The International Energy Agency (IEA) said the world won't be left short of oil even with lower output from sanctions-hit Russia. "Steadily rising volumes from...OPEC+ and the US along with a slowdown in demand growth is expected to fend off an acute supply deficit," the IEA said. This comes after it predicted a possible global oil "supply shock" in March.

177.title: CSK's Conway gets out on golden duck as DRS not available due to power issues
177.article_body: CSK opener Devon Conway was dismissed for a golden duck after the on-field umpire adjudged him LBW out off MI's Daniel Sams. Conway couldn't take a review as the facility wasn't available due to power issues in the stadium. After watching the replay, commentator Simon Doull was heard saying, "Oh dear me. It's missing leg [stump] by a long way."

178.title: Global crypto regulation body likely in next year: IOSCO Chair
178.article_body: The International Organisation of Securities Commissions' (IOSCO) Chair Ashley Alder said global market regulators are likely to launch a joint body within the next year to better co-ordinate cryptocurrency rules. "There's a wall of worry about this (crypto)...at an institutional level," Alder stated. He added that the main concerns are cyber security and a lack of transparency, among others.

179.title: Ather Energy raises $128 mn led by state-owned NIIFL, Hero MotoCorp
179.article_body: Ather Energy has raised $128 million in its Series E round of funding, the electric two-wheeler maker said on Thursday. The round was led by India's sovereign wealth fund National Investment and Infrastructure Fund Limited's (NIIFL) Strategic Opportunities Fund (SOF) and Hero MotoCorp, among others. With this investment, the Bengaluru-based company has raised over $230 million financing to date.

180.title: N Korea fires 3 suspected ballistic missiles, 16th weapons test in 2022
180.article_body: North Korea on Thursday fired three suspected short-range ballistic missiles toward the sea off its east coast, the South Korean military said. This is said to be the country's 16th known weapons test this year. The launch came hours after North Korea confirmed its first-ever COVID-19 infection and declared a "serious emergency", with leader Kim Jong-un ordering a national lockdown.

181.title: Cong has capability, leadership to reform from within: Hooda
181.article_body: Senior Congress leader Bhupinder Singh Hooda on Friday asserted that the party has the capability and the leadership to reform itself from within. On whether demands such as setting up a parliamentary board would be discussed, he said, "Election process is going on, it will be completed in a few months, other things will be looked upon after the election."

182.title: Appeasement politics ends with 100% coverage of govt schemes: PM Modi
182.article_body: Politics of appeasement comes to an end with 100% coverage of government schemes, Prime Minister Narendra Modi said on Thursday. He was addressing 'Utkarsh Samaroh' in Gujarat, via video conferencing and said, "Due to lack of information about government schemes, they either remain on paper or people not entitled for such schemes take benefit."

183.title: First pic of supermassive black hole at the centre of Milky Way released
183.article_body: Astronomers have unveiled the first image of the supermassive black hole at the centre of the Milky Way galaxy. "The new view captures light bent by the powerful gravity of the black hole, which is four million times more massive than our Sun," astronomers said. The image was produced by a global research team called the Event Horizon Telescope Collaboration.

184.title: Investors lose nearly ₹19 lakh crore in five trading sessions
184.article_body: The wealth of equity investors tumbled by over ₹18.74 lakh crore as the market indices continued to fall for the fifth session on Thursday. While the Sensex plunged 1,158 points to end at 52,930 on Thursday, the Nifty plunged 359 points to settle at 15,808. Markets continued to remain under pressure in sync with the global markets slump, experts said.

185.title: Largest white diamond ever auctioned, larger than a golf ball, sold for $21.9 mn
185.article_body: 'The Rock', the biggest white diamond ever auctioned, was sold for 21,681,000 Swiss francs ($21.9 million) by auction house Christie's in Geneva. The pear-cut diamond of 228.31 carats, larger than a golf ball, was sold by an unnamed owner from North America and was bought by a private collector bidding by telephone. The pre-sale estimate was 19-30 million Swiss francs.

186.title: Meta tells hardware staffers to prepare for cutbacks: Report
186.article_body: Meta is preparing cutbacks in its Reality Labs division, a unit which is part of the company's strategy to refocus on hardware products and the metaverse, Reuters reported citing a spokesperson. Meta Chief Technology Officer Andrew Bosworth on Tuesday said the changes are expected within a week. Meta isn't planning layoffs as part of the changes, the spokesperson added.

187.title: MI to bowl first against CSK in bottom-of-the-table clash, Kieron Pollard dropped
187.article_body: MI captain Rohit Sharma won the toss and elected to bowl first against CSK in the bottom-of-the-table clash in IPL 2022. Bottom-placed MI have dropped Kieron Pollard from their playing XI and have replaced him with Tristan Stubbs. They have also included Hrithik Shokeen in place of Murugan Ashwin. Meanwhile, ninth-placed CSK are fielding the same playing XI.

188.title: It does disappoint: Kiara Advani on role of actresses in comedy films
188.article_body: Actress Kiara Advani, speaking about comedy films, has said, "It's very rare that a female protagonist adds a punch." She added that the character arc of a male protagonist and a female protagonist cannot be compared. "Unfortunately that's how (the script) is written...It definitely does disappoint," Kiara further said. The actress will next be seen in 'Bhool Bhulaiyaa 2'.

189.title: DS Chauhan given additional charge of UP DGP after Mukul Goel's removal
189.article_body: IPS officer and DG Intelligence DS Chauhan has been given the additional charge of Uttar Pradesh Director General of Police (DGP), a day after Mukul Goel was removed from the post for reportedly neglecting his work. Goel has been made the Director General (DG) of the Civil Defence department, as per an official statement. Goel is a 1987-batch IPS officer.

190.title: Got colonial characters in India due to white face: 'RRR' actor Edward
190.article_body: American actor Edward Sonnenblick, who featured in 'RRR', has said, "There was...niche for someone like me in the industry, white faces got colonial characters. That's the majority of roles that come my way." However, he added he does get to play other roles in films like 'Saving Chintu' where he played an American guy trying to adopt a kid.

191.title: Make Tamil official language of Madras HC: TN CM Stalin to PM Modi
191.article_body: Tamil Nadu CM MK Stalin wrote to PM Narendra Modi and Chief Justice NV Ramana on Thursday urging them to fulfil three demands, including making Tamil the official language of Madras HC. Stalin in his letter added that there should be diversity in appointment of judges. Thirdly, he cited the need for setting up permanent regional benches of SC.

192.title: Rishabh Pant has made simple mistakes with his shot selection: Watson
192.article_body: DC assistant coach Shane Watson said the team's captain Rishabh Pant has made "simple" mistakes with his shot selection in IPL 2022 so far. "Little things haven't gone Pant's way. A couple of random chop ons out of nowhere," added Watson. "Pant's mindset is to entertain. He would prefer to go down taking the game on than...being defensive," stated Watson.

193.title: Congress stages protest against inflation & unemployment in Bhopal
193.article_body: Madhya Pradesh Youth Congress staged a protest against the BJP government in Madhya Pradesh regarding issues like inflation, corruption and unemployment in Bhopal. Congress State President Kamal Nath was also present during the protest and the protesters marched towards CM's residence, raising slogans against the government. The police used water cannons on the protesting Congress workers.

194.title: Attempt to get publicity: Pawar on Patole's 'backstabber' remark
194.article_body: Maharashtra Deputy CM and NCP leader Ajit Pawar criticised Maharashtra Congress chief Nana Patole's "backstabber" comment and said that it was an "attempt to get publicity". He said, "We know from which party he has come. Does that mean he has stabbed someone?" Earlier, Patole called NCP a backstabber after they joined hands with BJP during Gondia Zilla Parishad elections.

195.title: Muslims being harassed in BJP regime: BSP Supremo Mayawati
195.article_body: Bahujan Samaj Party (BSP) Supremo Mayawati criticised the Yogi Adityanath-led BJP government in Uttar Pradesh and claimed that Muslims were being harassed in BJP-ruled states. In a series of tweets, Mayawati accused the Uttar Pradesh government of harassing political opponents. She also condemned the government for keeping SP leader Azam Khan in jail for about two-and-a-half years.

196.title: Ukraine to put first Russian soldier on trial for war crimes: Report
196.article_body: Amid Russia's ongoing invasion, Ukraine to put the first Russian soldier on trial for war crimes, DW quoted Ukraine's top prosecutor Iryna Venediktova as saying. Vadim Shishimarin, a 21-year-old Russian soldier, will reportedly face the trial for killing an unarmed 62-year-old man in Ukraine. Shishimarin could face fifteen years imprisonment on charges of war crimes and premeditated murder.

197.title: India's industrial output rises from 1.5% in Feb to 1.9% in Mar
197.article_body: India's industrial output, measured in terms of the Index of Industrial Production (IIP), witnessed a growth of 1.9% in March, up from 1.5% in February. This comes after data released on April 29 showed output of India's eight core sectors grew 4.3% YoY in March 2022, down from 6% in February 2022. The eight sectors account for 40.3% of IIP.

198.title: Ranil Wickremesinghe takes oath as new PM of crisis-hit Sri Lanka
198.article_body: Ranil Wickremesinghe, an opposition lawmaker, has been sworn in as the new Prime Minister of Sri Lanka by President Gotabaya Rajapaksa amid political and economic crisis in the country. This comes days after former PM Mahinda Rajapaksa quit his post and went to an undisclosed location with his family amid protests in the island nation.

199.title: SRK-led Knight Riders Group acquires Abu Dhabi franchise in UAE's T20 League
199.article_body: Shah Rukh Khan-led Knight Riders Group has acquired the Abu Dhabi franchise in UAE's T20 League.  "We're excited about becoming part of UAE’s T20 League, which no doubt will become hugely successful," Shah Rukh said. As many as six teams will compete in UAE's T20 League. Reliance Industries Limited also owns a team in the league.

200.title: India needs a stronger Oppn: Spiritual leader Sri Sri Ravi Shankar
200.article_body: Spiritual leader Sri Sri Ravi Shankar said that India needs a "stronger Opposition" and called the current Opposition "weak". He said, "Lack of leadership in the Opposition can make any democracy appear not as a democracy." He added, "West Bengal has shown that with free-and-fair elections, no party can meddle with the institutions of India."

201.title: Indian Army to buy 12 Swathi weapon-locating radars for China border
201.article_body: The Indian Army has put up a proposal to the Defence Ministry for buying 12 'Swathi' weapon-locating radars developed by DRDO. Swathi weapon-locating radars provide fast, automatic and accurate location of enemy weapons like mortars, shells and rockets within 50-kilometre range. The Army has been using the radars for its operations along the Line of Control in Jammu and Kashmir.

202.title: Need action against those who filed sedition cases due to pressure: BJP MP
202.article_body: BJP MP from Mumbai North, Gopal Shetty, said on Wednesday that strong action must be taken against those officials who have filed sedition cases against individuals "under pressure". Shetty's comments come as SC has permitted the Centre to re-examine the provisions of Section 124A of IPC that criminalises sedition. Over 300 sedition cases have been filed since 2014.

203.title: Biden administration has taken Quad to leader level: White House
203.article_body: White House on Wednesday said that the US President Joe Biden-led US administration has taken the Quad to the leader level. "We are the first administration that has taken the Quad- that is the United States, Australia, India, and Japan- to the leader level," a senior administration official said. His remarks came on the eve of the US-ASEAN Special Summit.

204.title: Mumbai is at flood risk again: AAP as it criticises BMC
204.article_body: The Aam Aadmi Party accused the Mumbai civic body BMC of shoddy pre-monsoon work and said Mumbai is at flood risk again. AAP demanded an external independent body to be appointed to audit the pre-monsoon preparation of BMC. "The Shiv Sena government has shown complete apathy to death and devastation caused in Mumbai year after year," AAP Mumbai president said.

205.title: BJP-led Centre may amend sedition law instead of revoking it: Moitra
205.article_body: TMC MP Mahua Moitra on Thursday said the BJP-led Centre is "not keen on revoking the draconian legislation (sedition law)" and may instead amend it. This comes a day after the Supreme Court put the sedition law on hold. "Had the Centre been serious in reconsidering the law, it could have done it in the last eight years," she added.

206.title: Can't do 'Koffee With Karan' but can do 'Tea with Twinkle', jokes Twinkle
206.article_body: Actress-turned-writer Twinkle Khanna took to Instagram and shared a photo of herself with a cup and rollers on her hair. "Can't do 'Koffee with Karan' again but 'Tea with Twinkle' may not be a bad idea after all," she captioned her post. Twinkle appeared on the show, hosted by Karan Johar, with her husband Akshay Kumar in season five.

207.title: Another internet shutdown in Raj after attack on VHP leader
207.article_body: Mobile internet services were suspended and communal tension gripped Rajasthan's Nohar town after VHP leader Satveer Saharan was attacked by some people, officials said on Thursday. Saharan was attacked on Wednesday evening when he, along with others, objected to a group of people sitting on a vacant plot next to a temple and creating a nuisance.

208.title: UP govt makes singing national anthem mandatory in all state madrasas
208.article_body: The Uttar Pradesh government has made it mandatory for students and teachers to sing the national anthem before starting classes in all madrasas of the state. The order has been implemented from May 12 (Thursday). UP Cabinet Minister Danish Azad said, "When the national anthem is sung, students would learn society's values."

209.title: Garbage collectors return bag with jewellery & cash in Navi Mumbai
209.article_body: Two garbage collectors returned a bag with gold jewellery, cash and a mobile phone to its owners after they found it during garbage collection in Navi Mumbai's Uran. The owner of the bag, Sushali Dhananjay Nakhwa, a fish seller, lost it while he was going to hospital. The garbage collectors found the bag, approached the police and returned it.

210.title: Can't get married as rumours are spread that I beat up boys: Kangana
210.article_body: Actress Kangana Ranaut, in an interview with RJ Siddharth Kannan, was asked if she is like her character in 'Dhaakad' in real life. To this, she replied, "Who will I beat up in real life? I'm unable to get married because of people like you spreading these rumours." "Rumours are spread about me that I beat up boys," she added.

211.title: Korean in Gurugram hits cook with pressure cooker for missing train
211.article_body: A Korean resident of Gurugram allegedly beat his Nepali cook for missing the train to his home, police said on Wednesday. The complainant said that he took leave from May 10 to go to his country, but missed his train. His employer beat him with a pressure cooker lid when he went back, the complainant said, according to the police.

212.title: Mumbai to get a single planning authority: Aaditya Thackeray
212.article_body: Deliberations are being held to set up a single planning authority headed by an "empowered" mayor for Mumbai, Maharashtra Tourism Minister Aaditya Thackeray said on Thursday. Project implementation will remain with existing agencies such as Mumbai Metropolitan Region Development Authority. "To repair one footpath...there are 42 utilities and coordination is required for each one," Thackeray said.

213.title: Biker falls on road as car driver abruptly opens door in Hyd; video surfaces
213.article_body: A man riding a bike fell on the road after the driver of a parked car abruptly opened the door in Hyderabad. The Cyberabad Traffic Police has shared a video of the incident that shows people running to help the man on the bike. "Always use your furthest hand to open the door," the police said.

214.title: India's retail inflation surges to 7.79% in April, highest in 8 years
214.article_body: India's retail inflation surged to 7.79% in April 2022, the highest since May 2014, data released by the government on Thursday showed. At 7.79%, the Consumer Price Index (CPI) inflation for April is higher than the March number of 6.95%. Earlier this month, RBI Governor Shaktikanta Das had said inflation was "expected to be elevated" in April.

215.title: You don't work for it: Arjun on being generation's 1st actor to cross ₹100-cr mark
215.article_body: On being asked about being first actor from his generation to have crossed ₹100-crore mark, actor Arjun Kapoor said, "Yes I was the first (actor of my generation) to cross the ₹100-crore mark but that's not something you work for. You work for making films that continuously do well. The numbers evolve. Phases happen in an actor's life."

216.title: ED raids premises of former Odisha MLA, seizes FDs worth over ₹133 crore
216.article_body: Enforcement Directorate has carried out raids at various premises linked to former Odisha MLA Jitendra Nath Patnaik in a money laundering case linked to alleged illegal mining. "A seizure of cash amounting to ₹70 lakh and 124 fixed deposits amounting to ₹133.17 crore has been made," the ED said. Patnaik is a former independent MLA from the Champua Assembly constituency.

217.title: Thane Police allegedly extort ₹6 crore from toy trader, 10 officers suspended
217.article_body: Ten policemen who were attached with Mumbra police station under Thane City Police Commissionerate have been suspended after they allegedly extorted ₹6 crore from toy trader and builder, Faisal Memon, last month. Reports said police claimed they had tip-off about unaccounted cash with Memon. A complainant, Shaikh Ibrahim, said police forcibly took ₹6 crore from Memon to suppress the case.

218.title: Woman receives head injuries in leopard attack, 4th incident in 3 days
218.article_body: A 45-year-old woman received severe head injuries after being attacked by a leopard in Pune's Khed taluka on Thursday. This is the fourth such attack in the last three days. Three people, including two women, were injured in three separate incidents of leopard attack in Khed and Ambegaon talukas on Tuesday night and Wednesday morning.

219.title: Over $200 billion wiped off cryptocurrency market in 24 hours
219.article_body: More than $200 billion of wealth was wiped out from the cryptocurrency market in just 24 hours amid a massive sell-off, Bloomberg reported on Thursday citing CoinMarketCap data. The crypto plunge was driven by the collapse of the TerraUSD stablecoin. The plunge affected major tokens and Bitcoin plunged by as much as 10% to its lowest level since December 2020.

220.title: Kashmiri Pandit shot dead by terrorists in J&K
220.article_body: A Kashmiri Pandit, identified as Rahul Bhat, was shot dead by terrorists in J&K's Budgam district in what is said to be an instance of a targeted attack. "Terrorists fired upon one employee namely Shri Rahul Bhat from minority community in Tehsildar office, Chadoora," Kashmir Police said. He was hospitalised after the attack but succumbed to his injuries.

221.title: Pune boy who was locked with 20 dogs needs mental health evaluation: Experts
221.article_body: After the parents of an 11-year-old boy allegedly confined him to his house in Pune with more than 20 dogs, experts say that the boy and his parents need extensive mental health evaluation. "Helping the child get back into the mainstream is vital," a child and adolescent psychiatrist said. The boy has been rescued and sent to a shelter home.

222.title: Finland joining NATO is definite threat to us: Russia
222.article_body: The Kremlin on Thursday said Finland's move to join NATO was "definitely" a threat to Russia and threatened an unspecified response. The expansion of the US-led military alliance "does not make our continent [Europe] more stable and secure", Kremlin spokesman Dmitry Peskov said. Finland, which shares a 1,300-kilometre  border with Russia, has joined "unfriendly steps" against Russia, he added.

223.title: I'm mortified, have a lot of anxiety; won't watch 'Doctor Strange..': Elizabeth
223.article_body: Actress Elizabeth Olsen, when asked about being leading lady in a blockbuster movie, said that she is mortified and has a lot of anxiety about 'Doctor Strange in the Multiverse of Madness'. She added she will not be watching the movie and that she is facing such pressure for the first time. "I've never...had to lead...commercial film...by myself," she added.

224.title: BJP is diverting people's attention from real issues: Sachin Pilot
224.article_body: Congress leader Sachin Pilot on Thursday accused the BJP of diverting people's attention from the real issues. He said, "There is chaos in the fiscal management and the economic policies of the government have been a monumental failure and there is no accountability in the government." His remarks came before the party's "Nav Sankalp Chintan Shivir" in Udaipur.

225.title: 26,650 Russian soldiers killed, 1,195 enemy tanks destroyed: Ukraine
225.article_body: Ukraine's Foreign Ministry on Thursday claimed that about 26,650 Russian soldiers have been killed since the Russian invasion began on February 24. Ukraine forces have destroyed 1,195 Russian tanks and 360 aircraft, including 161 helicopters, the ministry added. Ukraine also claimed to have destroyed 2,873 armoured personnel carriers, 534 artillery systems and 191 multiple launch rocket systems.

226.title: SUGAR Cosmetics looks to double revenue, expand to 60,000 stores
226.article_body: D2C beauty brand SUGAR Cosmetics is targeting to double its gross revenues to ₹600 crore in FY23 and achieve net revenue of over ₹500 crore, CEO Vineeta Singh said. The Shark Tank India judge added that the brand's looking to expand its offline presence to over 60,000 stores in the next 12-15 months. Currently, it's available in about 30,000 outlets.

227.title: NDRF conducts field trials of unmanned vehicles, gadgets in Pune
227.article_body: The National Disaster Response Force (NDRF) conducted field trials of unmanned aerial and marine vehicles and other modern gadgets on May 10 and 11 at headquarters of 5th Battalion at Sudumbare in Pune. As many as 10 firms showcased their equipment that can be used in disaster relief operations. The exhibited technologies included drone-based aerial mapping and advanced image analytics.

228.title: I want to steal Djokovic's elasticity, Nadal's self-sacrifice: Alcaraz
228.article_body: Spain's Carlos Alcaraz said he wants to steal Novak Djokovic's elasticity and physique as well as Roger Federer's elegance. "I would steal Rafael Nadal's fighting spirit, self-sacrifice, work ethic. If I have to train three hours, I train at 200 percent intensity," added Alcaraz. "I want to continue climbing...If it can be to heaven, even better," stated Alcaraz.

229.title: Don't pick up call & ask 'Should I work on particular project': Nazia on Sanjay
229.article_body: Actress Nazia Hussain, who is the grand daughter of actor Sanjay Dutt's maternal uncle, said that she does not pick up the call and ask the actor if she should be taking up particular projects. "When you are related to someone who's such a big star, it's constantly like 'Am I going to be good enough'," she added.

230.title: US' Arizona carries out 1st execution in 8 years
230.article_body: US' Arizona on Wednesday carried out its first execution since 2014, putting to death a prisoner convicted of killing a 21-year-old student 44 years ago. Clarence Dixon, convicted of stabbing and strangling of Arizona State University student Deana Bowdoin in 1978, was executed by lethal injection. Dixon is the sixth person to be executed in US this year.

231.title: Muslim cleric insults Class 10 girl on stage in Kerala; Guv criticises him
231.article_body: A Muslim cleric allegedly scolded organisers of an event for inviting a Class 10 girl student on stage to receive an award in Kerala's Malappuram district. Governor Arif Mohammed Khan has criticised the cleric for humiliating the girl student. The Governor said, "I am so deeply disappointed that the whole political leadership is silent about it."

232.title: AAP MLA detained for protesting anti-encroachment drive in south Delhi
232.article_body: AAP MLA Amanatullah Khan and his supporters, who were protesting against an anti-encroachment drive in Delhi's Madanpur Khadar area, were detained on Thursday. "I am ready to go to jail if it saves the houses of poor people. There is no encroachment here. I will support them in demolition if there is any encroachment," said Amanatullah.

233.title: Are we here to decide who built Taj Mahal?: HC on PIL seeking to open Taj Mahal rooms
233.article_body: While rejecting a petition seeking to open 22 closed doors in Taj Mahal, Allahabad High Court asked the petitioner, "Are we here to decide who built Taj Mahal?" The court said, "Please don't take us to the historical facts which you believe." It added that such debates are for drawing rooms, not for a court of law.

234.title: Man gets fake wife to donate kidney in Pune; she reveals identity on not getting ₹15 lakh
234.article_body: Fifteen people have been booked over an alleged kidney racket after a woman was promised ₹15 lakh to pose as the wife of a man who needed a transplant. She donated her kidney to a young woman and in turn, the young woman's mother donated her kidney to the man. The woman revealed her real identity after dispute over money.

235.title: Canada to fly in about 900 Ukrainian refugees from Poland
235.article_body: Canada will reportedly bring in about 900 Ukrainian refugees from Poland between late May and early June. The country is going to arrange three flights from Poland's Warsaw to three of its cities - Winnipeg on May 23, Montreal on May 29 and Halifax on June 2. In March, Canada allowed the Ukrainian refugees to stay for three years.

236.title: Cong will have to remain pivot of anti-BJP formation for 2024 polls: Pilot
236.article_body: Congress leader Sachin Pilot said Congress is and will have to remain the "pivot" around which an anti-BJP coalition is formed to take on the 2024 Lok Sabha elections. "A UPA plus plus formation might be the best one to take on the NDA," Pilot added. "Don't forget NDA has lost many partners since 2019," Pilot stated.

237.title: Cong to introspect strengths, weaknesses during 'Chintan Shivir': Surjewala
237.article_body: Congress leader Randeep Surjewala on Thursday said the party will introspect its strengths and weaknesses during its 'Chintan Shivir'. "Considering...current challenges and situations, our efficiency and skills are not only important to evaluate but bring changes to them as well," he said. Surjewala further stated inflation, unemployment and increasing debt as reasons for holding the session.

238.title: 4 killed, several injured as car overturns after hitting divider in J'khand
238.article_body: Four people died and several others were injured on Thursday after their car hit a road divider and overturned in Jharkhand's Seraikela-Kharsawan district. According to an official, the victims were going to Urmal village after attending a wedding ceremony in Ramgarh area of the district. Three persons were killed on the spot while one died during treatment, the official added.

239.title: 4 killed in suicide blast ahead of presidential vote in Somalia
239.article_body: At least four people were reportedly killed in a suicide blast in Somalia's capital Mogadishu on Wednesday. "I saw four people dead at the scene. Two of them were government soldiers who died immediately after the attack," said a police officer. This comes days ahead of the presidential election that is set to take place on Sunday.

240.title: China's engagement with South Pacific countries no threat to Aus: Envoy
240.article_body: China's Ambassador to Australia Xiao Qian has said that the former's engagement with South Pacific countries is conducive to regional stability and isn't a threat to Australia's security. Qian's comments come amid concerns by Australia about a potential Chinese military presence in the Solomon Islands following a bilateral security deal. China and Solomon Islands signed the pact in April.

241.title: Been a 22-day rigorous struggle to get mom out of hospital: Urvashi Dholakia
241.article_body: Actress Urvashi Dholakia shared the reason for her absence on social media and said she was taking care of her ailing mother. Taking to Instagram Story, Urvashi wrote, "[It has] been a 22-day rigorous struggle to get mom out of the hospital but now she is back home. The struggle though isn't over as tremendous care has to be taken."

242.title: Director had options but he backed his casting of Alia & me: Arjun on 2 States
242.article_body: As Arjun Kapoor completed 10 years in Bollywood on May 11, he celebrated it by conducting an 'ask me anything' session on Instagram. During the session, one of his fans wrote, "'2 States' is...one of my favourite films." In response, Arjun said, "Our director Abhishek Verman...backed his casting of @aliabhatt and me when he had many options to choose from."

243.title: Hindu Rashtra doesn't mean others can't practice faith: Haryana BJP MLA
243.article_body: BJP MLA from Haryana's Ambala City Aseem Goel said Hindu Rashtra (country) doesn't mean asking people of other religions to stop practicing their faith. "Isn't it justified for a country with 100 crore Hindus to call for a nation for which our ancestors sacrificed their lives for centuries?" Goel said. He had recently pledged to make "Hindustan a Hindu Rashtra".

244.title: Actress Chhavi Mittal shares pic showing her scar after breast cancer surgery
244.article_body: Actress Chhavi Mittal took to Instagram to share a picture showing her scar, days after her breast cancer surgery. "I did the unthinkable! I went to the gym today...I could do squats, lunges, Bulgarian split squats, calf raises, single-leg squats and sumo squats," she wrote. "I even got to sport my scar on the armpit while at it," she added.

245.title: I've been raped multiple times because I was too drunk to say 'Stop': Actress Selma Blair
245.article_body: Hollywood actress Selma Blair stated in her memoir that she has been raped multiple times while being drunk. "I was too drunk to say the words 'Please. Stop'," she wrote. "I came out of each event quiet and ashamed," she added. She revealed she was once raped after a day of binge-drinking during a college spring break trip.

246.title: Chhattisgarh Ranji captain Harpreet booked in govt job cheating case
246.article_body: Chhattisgarh's Ranji Trophy team captain Harpreet Singh Bhatia has been booked for cheating and forgery after allegedly getting a government job in the office of Principal Accountant General (Audit) Chhattisgarh by submitting bogus documents. Harpreet had submitted a BCom degree certificate from Bundelkhand University, however, officials found that no such marksheet had been issued.

247.title: Felt that my kiss with Dharmendra was out of the box: Nafisa on Life In A Metro
247.article_body: When asked about the pre-climax scene in film 'Life In A Metro', where Nafisa Ali and Dharmendra share a kiss, the veteran actress replied, "When you are an actor, you have to portray whatever is required from your character. I felt...(the kiss) was out of the box and provided shock value." "Two old people don't...kiss in Hindi movies," she said.

248.title: Once Marsh gets going, he's one of the best T20 batters in the world: Watson
248.article_body: DC assistant coach Shane Watson said Mitchell Marsh is "one of the best T20 batters in the world" when he gets going. "It took Marsh a few games to get going...after the COVID-19 setback...[but] he adds a lot of value," added Watson. Marsh scored 89(62) to help DC chase down RR's 160-run total. Currently, DC are fifth on IPL standings.

249.title: Karnataka to bring anti-conversion ordinance: CM Bommai
249.article_body: Karnataka Chief Minister Basavaraj Bommai said the Cabinet is likely to approve the ordinance move for the anti-conversion bill in its cabinet meeting on Thursday. This comes after the state assembly passed an anti-conversion bill prohibiting conversion from one religion to another by "misrepresentation, force, fraud, allurement or marriage" in December amid Opposition protests.

250.title: 3 UP revenue dept officials among 4 booked for forging land records
250.article_body: Four persons, including three revenue department officials, have been booked for forging land records in Uttar Pradesh, police said on Thursday. The complainant, who claimed to own a property, alleged that it had been fraudulently registered in the name of another person. An FIR was registered against four people, including a revenue clerk officer and two accountants, police added.

251.title: Russia demands apology from Poland over red paint attack on envoy
251.article_body: Russia has demanded an "official apology" from Poland after Moscow's ambassador to Warsaw was doused with red paint by anti-war protesters. "A decision on further steps will be taken depending on Warsaw's reaction to our demands," Russia's Foreign Ministry said. Protesters attacked Sergey Andreev on Monday as he arrived to honour Red Army troops who died during Second World War.

252.title: Ramkrishna, Subramanian's bail pleas in NSE scam case rejected
252.article_body: A Delhi court on Thursday dismissed the bail pleas filed by NSE's ex-CEO Chitra Ramkrishna and ex-Group Operating Officer Anand Subramanian in connection with the co-location scam case. The CBI told the court that the accused, holding influential positions, could tamper with the evidence and must be kept in custody. Ramkrishna has been accused of frequently revising Subramanian's designation.

253.title: Child sandwiched between parents on scooter motivated me to build Nano: Tata
253.article_body: Tata Sons Chairman Emeritus Ratan Tata took to Instagram to share a picture of him with Tata Nano, the compact car that he launched in 2008. "What really motivated me...was constantly seeing Indian families on scooters, maybe the child sandwiched between the mother and father," Tata wrote on building Nano. "Nano was always meant for all our people," he added.

254.title: Need to create more districts in West Bengal: Mamata Banerjee
254.article_body: West Bengal Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee on Thursday said the state needs to be divided into more districts to accelerate the process of development. "We need to divide the districts as these are very large. The state will have more districts. This will help expedite development work," she said. For this, the state needs more manpower and infrastructure, she added.

255.title: Karnataka cabinet approves anti-conversion bill as ordinance: Home Minister
255.article_body: Karnataka cabinet has approved the anti-conversion bill and it will be discussed in the next Assembly session, the state Home Minister Araga Jnanendra said. Till then, the ordinance will be in place, he added. "Because the Assembly and Council got prorogued, we're placing a proposal to promulgate an ordinance in the cabinet," CM Basavaraj Bommai had said before the meeting.

256.title: AAP has done nothing: BJP to start campaign to ‘expose’ Delhi govt
256.article_body: BJP's Delhi unit has announced a 'Pol Khol' door-to-door campaign from 15-30 May in the national capital. The party workers will meet over 25 lakh families during the campaign and inform them about AAP government's failures citing 10 key points like unemployment, health, education, etc. "Kejriwal government has done nothing except making tall claims," Delhi BJP chief Adesh Gupta said.

257.title: We are trying for perfect implementation of all govt schemes: Goa CM
257.article_body: Goa Chief Minister Dr Pramod Sawant on Thursday said, "We are trying for a perfect implementation of all govt schemes." He assured that schemes related to housing, sanitation, electricity, social and financial security, equipment for Divyang, Kisan credit among others will be made available to all. "In third tenure of BJP...roads, tourism, medical...development have been taken up," he added.

258.title: 3 killed, 18 injured after vehicle turns upside down in Chhattisgarh
258.article_body: At least three people were killed and 18 were injured after a vehicle turned upside down near Dhodhoi Chowk in Chhattisgarh's Rajnandgaon district, police said on Thursday. The accident took place when the driver decided to take the vehicle off-road after spotting a cattle. The vehicle was carrying around 20-25 people who were returning from a wedding ceremony in Panchdewari.

259.title: Salman offers condolences to brother-in-law Aayush on his grandfather's death
259.article_body: Actor Salman Khan offered his condolences to his brother-in-law Aayush Sharma after his grandfather, former politician Pandit Sukh Ram Sharma's death. Sharing a photo of Aayush's grandfather on Instagram, Salman wrote, "Sending my heartfelt condolences to Aayush...on the loss of his grandfather Shri Sukhram ji today." The former Union Minister reportedly suffered a brain stroke.

260.title: Gang members hurl Molotov cocktails at police in TN; 5 arrested
260.article_body: Tamil Nadu Police on Thursday arrested five members of a gang for allegedly hurling Molotov cocktails at the police at an abandoned petroleum refinery in Cuddalore. On Wednesday morning, police visited the refinery after being informed that the gang had engaged in the theft of scrap materials. Seeing the police, the accused hurled Molotov cocktails and fled the spot.

261.title: 2 men, who illegally entered India, held in B'luru for stealing bikes
261.article_body: Bengaluru City Police on Thursday arrested two men on charges of stealing bikes and recovered eight bikes from their possession. According to police, the two men illegally crossed over to India in 2018 after a Bangladesh court sentenced them to five years of imprisonment in an assault case. Meanwhile, authorities have begun the process to deport the accused to Bangladesh.

262.title: Video shows woman slipping from train in Odisha, RPF constable saves her
262.article_body: A Railway Protection Force (RPF) head constable pulled a woman to safety after she slipped from a moving train at Bhubaneswar Railway Station on Wednesday. Reports said she was trying to deboard the train. In a video shared by IPS officer Dr Sudhanshu Sarangi, the woman can be seen losing balance and falling off the moving train.

263.title: People living in Mumbai don't need UP 'embassy': Maha Min Jayant Patil
263.article_body: Maharashtra Minister and NCP leader Jayant Patil said people living in Mumbai don't need a UP 'embassy' or office. His remarks came after Uttar Pradesh CM Yogi Adityanath announced the decision to set up an office in Mumbai to establish contact with UP natives in the city. Patil claimed it is being done ahead of BMC polls.

264.title: Sachin Bansal's Navi appoints Meesho Founder as independent director
264.article_body: Sachin Bansal's Navi has appointed social commerce platform Meesho Founder Vidit Aatrey as an independent director on its board. The company now has four independent directors on its board, forming a majority. Navi recently also appointed three other independent directors. The other board members include Bansal and former Deputy Governor of the Reserve Bank of India Anand Sinha.

265.title: Leopard found dead near a tea stall in Tamil Nadu
265.article_body: A leopard was found dead in Varattuparai in Tamil Nadu's Coimbatore on Thursday. According to Anamalai Tiger Reserve (ATR) officials, the animal's right foreleg was trapped in a henhouse behind the tea shop. "The animal could have died of shock after getting its foreleg stuck in the mesh of the henhouse while trying to catch chicken," an official said.

266.title: He was set to sign a new Barca contract: PSG's Paredes on teammate Messi
266.article_body: PSG midfielder Leo Paredes said his team's forward Lionel Messi was going to sign a new contract with Barcelona having arranged everything, before suddenly opting to join PSG instead. "I don't know what happened on that trip to Barcelona because the same night he was going to sign the contract, Messi told us he was coming here," added Paredes.

267.title: 4 CBI officers held for conducting fake raid to extort money in Chandigarh
267.article_body: The Chandigarh Police arrested four CBI officers for allegedly conducting a fake raid on an IT firm to extort money, officials said. On Wednesday, the accused allegedly went to Chandigarh to conduct a "search" even when they are not posted there and had no case or mandate for such an operation, the officials added.

268.title: Elections in Pak will only be held after poll reforms: Ex-Prez Zardari
268.article_body: Ex-Pakistani President Asif Ali Zardari has said that elections in the country will only be held after the introduction of poll reforms. "We have to change laws and improve them and then go to elections," he said. Former PM Imran Khan recently called for expedited polls in Pakistan after being ousted from power via a no-trust vote last month.

269.title: Go and research, do MA, PhD: Allahabad HC to man seeking opening of Taj Mahal rooms
269.article_body: The Allahabad High Court has dismissed a plea seeking opening of certain rooms of the Taj Mahal. "Go and research. Do MA. Do PhD. Then choose such a topic and if any institute disallows you to research then come to us," the court told the petitioner. The petitioner contends that Taj Mahal was a Shiva Temple, known as Tejo Mahalaya.

270.title: Tantrums, abuse weren't allowed in our house; kids could express: Priyanka's mom
270.article_body: Priyanka Chopra's mother Madhu Chopra said that even though their household was liberal, there were certain limitations. "Tantrums were never allowed, raised voices were never allowed, abuse was never allowed. With these things banned, they could express themselves," she added. She also said they used to discuss what happened in Priyanka and Siddharth's school and shared advice on it.

271.title: Mehbooba raising communal frenzy for petty political gains: BJP
271.article_body: Responding to Mehbooba Mufti's remarks on the economy, Jammu and Kashmir BJP chief spokesperson Sunil Sethi said that she was raising communal frenzy for petty political gains and to provoke people. He added that Mufti's tweets indicate her frustration with the growth of India as a world leader and the destructive situation existing in Pakistan, whose economy is in shambles.

272.title: Ford drops plans to make EVs for exports in India
272.article_body: Ford Motor has dropped plans to make electric vehicles (EVs) in India for exports. "After careful review, we have decided to no longer pursue EV manufacturing for exports from any of the Indian plants," a spokesperson said. In September 2021, Ford had announced it would cease local manufacturing in India, citing an operating loss of $2 billion over 10 years.

273.title: Laughter Champions to replace Kapil Sharma Show during US tour: Report
273.article_body: 'The Kapil Sharma Show' will reportedly be replaced by 'Laughter Champions' as comedian Kapil Sharma and his team will be on a US tour in June. The show will be judged by Archana Puran Singh and Shekhar Suman. A source told The Indian Express, "With no stand-up comedy show at the moment, the team decided to launch one."

274.title: B'luru locals write to MLA after being stranded for 20 hrs due to flooding
274.article_body: Residents of Rainbow Drive Layout in Bengaluru's Sarjapur have written a letter to Mahadevapura MLA Aravind Limbavali, seeking a solution to flooding problems. In the letter, they claimed that "due to major flooding on May 5 they were left stranded for over 20 hours without any access to medical help". Reportedly, they'd already written to BBMP, but to no avail.

275.title: Sensex crashes 1,158 points to close at 52,930 in the 5th-straight session of fall
275.article_body: Sensex fell for the fifth-straight day on Thursday, crashing 1,158 points to close at 52,930, while Nifty closed 359 points lower at 15,808. The market indices dropped over 2%, dragged by banking, financial and metal stocks amid worries over April inflation data and a decline in global stocks. Adani Ports, IndusInd Bank and Tata Steel were among the top losers.

276.title: Pune boy confined to house with dogs shifted to observation home
276.article_body: The 11-year-old boy who was allegedly confined in an apartment with 22 stray dogs by his parents in Pune's Kondhwa has been shifted to an observation home. Arrangements are being made to provide proper treatment and counselling to the minor, Child Welfare Committee (CWC) member Beena Hirekar said. The boy was reportedly kept with dogs for almost two years.

277.title: Elections to 57 Rajya Sabha seats to be held on June 10
277.article_body: The Election Commission of India on Thursday announced that the elections to 57 Rajya Sabha seats spread across 15 states will take place on June 10. As many as 11 seats are in Uttar Pradesh while six each are in Maharashtra and Tamil Nadu. The votes will be counted on the same day.

278.title: Can't attend my only brother's marriage due to tournaments: Record holder hurdler Jyothi
278.article_body: Jyothi Yarraji, who on Tuesday became the fastest Indian woman to run 100-metre hurdles, said that she won't be able to attend her only brother's marriage later this month due to tournaments. "I have hardly attended any family functions. I haven’t been home on festivals and I miss going out like my friends," the 22-year-old added.

279.title: Delete 'negative' posts within 24 hrs: Ola Electric's reply to customer's legal notice
279.article_body: Ola Electric, in response to Guwahati-based customer Balwant Singh's legal notice, asked him to delete negative comments against the company on social media and to stop making defamatory statements against the company. It warned Singh of action if the demands aren't met within 24 hours. Singh had demanded takedown of his son's scooter's telemetry data published publicly by Ola Electric.

280.title: Tomorrow you'll want to open judges' chambers: HC on plea to open Taj Mahal rooms
280.article_body: The Allahabad High Court on Thursday, while hearing a plea seeking to open closed rooms in the Taj Mahal, asked, "Tomorrow will you come and ask to go to the chambers of Honourable Judges?" The court also asked the petitioner to not make a mockery of the PIL system. The petitioner contends that the Taj Mahal was a Shiva temple.

281.title: Campbell Wilson appointed CEO and MD of Air India
281.article_body: Tata Sons has appointed Campbell Wilson as the new CEO and MD of Air India. "It's an honour to be selected to lead the iconic Air India. It's at the cusp of an exciting journey to become one of the best airlines," Wilson said. The 50-year-old New Zealand-born executive recently resigned as CEO of Singapore Airlines budget carrier Scoot.

282.title: HC allows Xiaomi conditional access to seized ₹5,551 cr: Report
282.article_body: The Karnataka High Court has declined to reinstate a freeze on ₹5,551 crore belonging to Chinese smartphone-maker Xiaomi, Hindustan Times reported citing Reuters. The funds were seized by the Enforcement Directorate in connection with "illegal outward remittances" but the seizure was stayed after Xiaomi appealed. The Court also allowed Xiaomi to use a bank overdraft facility to make payments.

283.title: Apple may drop iPhone Lightning port for USB-C in 2023: Report
283.article_body: Apple is planning to switch from the Lightning port on its iPhones to USB-C port in 2023, analyst Ming-Chi Kuo reported. He said that adopting USB-C "could improve iPhone's transfer and charging speed in hardware designs, but the final specification details still depend on iOS support." The EU had earlier proposed mandatory USB-C port on all devices, including iPhones.

284.title: Traffic disrupted after truck overturns on Delhi-Jaipur highway in Gurugram
284.article_body: Traffic remained disrupted in Gurugram after two trucks broke through the median and overturned on the main carriageway at Delhi-Jaipur NH-48 on Thursday. No casualties or injuries were reported in the incident. The concerned teams successfully removed the truck from the road. Gurugram Police also tweeted a video showing clear roads after the traffic got back to normal.

285.title: Lake activist booked over social media posts against B'luru civic body
285.article_body: Bruhat Bengaluru Mahanagara Palike has filed a complaint against lake activist Sandeep Anirudhan for spreading propaganda against BBMP officials and inciting people against a road project through social media posts. Anirudhan has claimed that the road project falls in the buffer zone of the Pattandur Agrahara Lake. However, BBMP has refuted his claims, alleging that he has a personal agenda.

286.title: Goa resort's room attendant rapes 12-yr-old Russian girl in pool, then in room
286.article_body: The Goa Police have arrested a man from his home town in neighbouring Karnataka for allegedly raping a 12-year-old Russian girl at a resort in Arambol in North Goa, where he worked as a room attendant. The girl's mother told police that her daughter was sexually assaulted in the swimming pool of the resort and later inside resort's room.

287.title: PM once stopped an important meeting and told staff to feed a hungry peacock: Shah
287.article_body: During an event to launch a book on PM Narendra Modi's political journey, Home Minister Amit Shah said that PM Modi once stopped an important meeting and told staff to feed a hungry peacock. "To think about a peacock while engaged in such a serious meeting shows how sensitive he is," Shah added.

288.title: Legally, a sex worker can say no, not married woman: Delhi HC judge on marital rape
288.article_body: While delivering a verdict on marital rape case, Delhi High Court judge Justice Rajiv Shakdher on Wednesday said, "[A] sex worker has been invested with the power to say 'no' by the law, but not a married woman." He had held the exception to Section 375 of IPC, which exempts forced sexual intercourse by a man with his wife, unconstitutional.

289.title: My mami has every right to slap me: Krushna on Govinda's wife Sunita
289.article_body: Speaking about his uncle Govinda and his wife Sunita, comedian-actor Krushna Abhishek said, "My mama is my blood but I don't share the same blood with my mami. But she let us stay with them for 7-8 years." "She loved me so much and that's why she has every right to scold me. She can slap me," he added.

290.title: Take responsibility, bat at no. 3 or no. 4: Gavaskar on Sanju Samson
290.article_body: Ex-India captain Sunil Gavaskar said RR captain Sanju Samson should take responsibility of batting at number three or number four, being a number four batter. Discussing Samson's six off four balls against DC, Gavaskar stated, "Samson suddenly found that because RR hadn't got the [required] start, he got to start playing...shots from the word go. In that attempt, he perished."

291.title: Upset over her 13 yrs long divorce case, Odisha woman tries killing self
291.article_body: A woman, who is a lawyer in Odisha's Balasore Court and has been fighting her divorce case for 13 years, tried to kill herself over slow progress of her case, her lawyer said. She was rushed to a hospital. Her condition is said to be stable. Reports said that she complained about monthly maintenance payments by her husband being irregular.

292.title: 37-yr-old man beaten up with sticks for molesting 13-yr-old in Delhi
292.article_body: A 37-year-old married man allegedly molested a 13-year-old girl when she was on her way to her tuition class in Delhi, following which he was beaten up by her parents and a group of men with stones and sticks. He was rescued by a beat officer patrolling the area and was arrested later. The accused man has three children.

293.title: IAS officer Pooja Singhal suspended by Jharkhand govt after being arrested by ED
293.article_body: Jharkhand government has suspended State Mining Secretary Pooja Singhal in connection with a money laundering case linked to alleged embezzlement of ₹18-crore MGNREGA funds. The IAS officer was arrested by the Enforcement Directorate on Wednesday. A viral video earlier showed over ₹17 crore in cash being recovered during a raid at the house of a CA linked to her.

294.title: Russia 'most direct threat' to world order, its pact with China worrying: EU
294.article_body: EU chief Ursula von der Leyen said that Russia "is today the most direct threat to the world order with the barbaric war against Ukraine and its worrying pact with China". The remarks came after her meeting with Japanese PM Fumio Kishida, who backed it up saying that Russia's action is not just a matter for Europe but Asia also.

295.title: Replacing Chahal is no mean feat: RCB spin bowling coach Sriram on Hasaranga
295.article_body: RCB spin bowling coach Sridharan Sriram said spinner Wanindu Hasaranga has handled the pressure and expectations brilliantly in the ongoing IPL season after being bought for ₹10.75 crore at the mega auction. "Replacing Yuzvendra Chahal at RCB is no mean feat...and to come and fill in his boots and be second on the [wicket-takers'] list is brilliant," he added.

296.title: SoftBank's Vision Fund reports record $26 billion loss
296.article_body: Japan's SoftBank Group reported a record $26.2 billion loss at its Vision Fund investment arm on Thursday. The group also reported a net loss of $13.2 billion for the financial year that ended March 31. This is reportedly its biggest full-year loss which followed a nearly $38.8 billion net profit in the previous fiscal year.

297.title: Pant should not even try doing what MS Dhoni does now: Ajay Jadeja
297.article_body: Ex-India batter Ajay Jadeja said DC captain Rishabh Pant "should not" even try doing what MS Dhoni does currently, adding that Pant should do what Dhoni used to do at his age. "Pant is a young player but [it] feels like he's been made a senior statesman very early," stated Ajay. Dhoni's current strike rate in IPL 2022 is 139.31.

298.title: Pune ZP to develop its land on Sinhagad Fort for heritage purposes
298.article_body: Pune Zilla Parishad (ZP) has decided to develop the land it owns on the top of Sinhagad Fort to promote tourism and heritage activities at the monument. "We have asked private agencies to come forward and submit a development plan for the land," said Yuvraj Desai, Executive Engineer of Pune ZP. E-bus facility to reach monument was also launched recently.

299.title: He may have his reasons: Boney on Mahesh Babu's 'B'wood can't afford me' remark
299.article_body: During a recent media interaction, Telugu actor Mahesh Babu reportedly said that "Bollywood cannot afford" him. Reacting to the same, producer Boney Kapoor said, "I can't comment on this because I belong to both sides, Bollywood and South." "Also, Mahesh has the right to say whatever he feels...He may have his own reasons for saying this," Boney added.

300.title: Humsafar to expand doorstep diesel services to 200 more cities
300.article_body: Humsafar India, which delivers diesel at the doorstep, said on Thursday that it is planning to expand its services to 200 more cities in the current fiscal year. The startup added that it is looking to venture into e-mobile vehicle charging stations business and is negotiating with some companies. Currently, Humsafar offers services in about 100 cities across India.

301.title: Gyanvapi mosque survey to continue, submit report by May 17: UP court
301.article_body: The survey of Uttar Pradesh's Gyanvapi mosque will continue, a court said on Thursday. It further refused to remove Court Commissioner Ajay Mishra and directed the commission to submit a report by May 17. The survey was earlier ordered on a plea by five women to gain year-long access to prayers at a Hindu shrine in Gyanvapi-Kashi Vishwanath complex.

302.title: Drunk bouncer back from wedding fires in air in Mohali society, booked
302.article_body: A bouncer, Happy, was booked by Punjab Police after he fired gunshots in air in a society in Mohali on Thursday. Happy, along with his employers, had gone to attend a wedding in Ambala. Upon returning, Happy, who was drunk, fired twice in air. RWA official said that youngsters accompanying Happy apologised. However, Happy fired twice again and ran away.

303.title: These issues will break country: Sanjay Raut on Gyanvapi mosque case
303.article_body: Speaking about the Gyanvapi mosque case, Shiv Sena leader Sanjay Raut on Thursday said all this is happening to gain political benefits and these issues will "break" the country. "After Ram temple, now peace is needed," Raut added. Earlier, Congress’ Pramod Tiwari said BJP is trying to turn the case into an Ayodhya-like issue so that they can politicise it.

304.title: 2 men rape woman at knifepoint, record act on phone camera in Mumbai
304.article_body: Two men allegedly raped a 19-year-old woman at knifepoint in Mumbai's Dharavi, according to a report. The victim was reportedly asleep when the accused entered her house. While one of the accused threatened the woman with a knife, the other filmed a video of the act on his phone camera. Meanwhile, police have registered a case and launched an investigation.

305.title: Parents thrash Delhi man for stalking, molesting their 13-yr-old daughter
305.article_body: Parents of a 13-year-old girl allegedly thrashed a 37-year-old man for stalking their daughter in Delhi. The minor had complained to her parents that the accused, Irfan Khan, was stalking her on her way to tuition. When her parents followed her on May 7 and saw Khan misbehaving with her, they along with others attacked him with stones and sticks.

306.title: Didn't understand what Mahesh meant by B'wood can't afford him: RGV
306.article_body: Reacting to actor Mahesh Babu's 'Bollywood can't afford me' remark, filmmaker Ram Gopal Varma said, "I honestly didn't understand what he meant by Bollywood can't afford him." "Bollywood isn't a company. It's a label given by...media. An individual movie company...will ask you to do a film at a particular cost...how can he generalise Bollywood, I don't understand that," he added.

307.title: Ola Electric CMO Varun Dubey quits days after CTO's exit
307.article_body: Ola Electric's Chief Marketing Officer (CMO) Varun Dubey has resigned from the company citing personal reasons as the startup grapples with customer complaints and Ola e-scooter fires. The development comes days after Chief Technology Officer (CTO) Dinesh Radhakrishnan departed in a series of top-level exits at Ola. Arun Sirdeshmukh, head of Ola's used-car business Ola Cars, also quit recently.

308.title: Singer Adele shares pic of her new mansion said to be worth around ₹450 crore
308.article_body: Singer Adele and boyfriend Rich Paul have shared a picture of them standing outside what is thought to be the couple's first home together. The mansion, said to be worth $58 million (around ₹450 crore) was previously owned by Sylvester Stallone and is located in the Beverly Hills area of Los Angeles. "Time flies," wrote Adele while sharing the photo.

309.title: My father's entire battalion installed projector to watch my debut: MI spinner Kartikeya
309.article_body: MI's Kumar Kartikeya, who describes himself as a mystery spinner, revealed in a video for MI that his policeman father's entire battalion installed a projector to watch his IPL debut in Jhansi. Kartikeya added, "When I took my first wicket, everyone clapped for [my father] and hugged him. When he shared that video, that was an unparalleled feeling for me."

310.title: PM tears up as girl says she wants to be doctor because of visually challenged father
310.article_body: PM Narendra Modi was seen tearing up while speaking to a visually challenged man and his daughter who studies in Class 12 in Gujarat. Ayub Patel said his vision was affected after adverse reaction from an eye-drop. Patel's daughter said she wants to be a doctor because of her father's problem and broke down, following which PM Modi got emotional.

311.title: Can't finish semi-final at 1 am, play final next day: Djokovic backs Zverev
311.article_body: Reacting to Alexander Zverev criticising the ATP Tour for scheduling his Madrid Open final a day after his semi-final, Novak Djokovic said, "You can't finish your semi-final match at 1 am and play the final...next day." "I understand...they want to sell more tickets...but that can cause problems," added Djokovic. Zverev lost his Madrid Open final against Carlos Alcaraz.

312.title: Many Sri Lankans leave Colombo after curfew lifted temporarily
312.article_body: Hundreds of Sri Lankans crowded the main bus station of Colombo to leave the capital and return to their hometowns after the curfew was temporarily lifted till 2 pm on Thursday. The streets in the city mostly remained quiet with people going out only to get essential supplies. Notably, a shoot-on-sight order has been issued against rioters.

313.title: SC refuses interim relief to those seeking stay on LIC IPO allotment
313.article_body: The Supreme Court on Thursday refused to grant interim relief to petitioners who challenged amendments to the LIC Act by Finance Act of 2021 and demanded a stay on the insurer's IPO allotment process. "We're not inclined to grant any interim relief," SC said. It also sought the Centre and LIC's replies on the batch of pleas within eight weeks.

314.title: India's most valuable startup BYJU'S in talks to raise over $1 billion: Report
314.article_body: India's most valuable startup BYJU'S is in talks with banks to raise over $1 billion to fund its acquisitions, Bloomberg reported. Bengaluru-based edtech startup BYJU'S is in talks with banks, including Morgan Stanley and JPMorgan Chase & Co, for the funding to reportedly acquire another edtech company. BYJU'S last raised $800 million in funding at a $22 billion valuation.

315.title: Sri Lanka's ex-PM Mahinda Rajapaksa, his son and allies banned from leaving country
315.article_body: A Sri Lankan court on Thursday banned former Prime Minister Mahinda Rajapaksa, his politician son Namal and several allies from leaving the country over acts of violence against anti-government demonstrators. Police has been asked to investigate Monday's mob attacks on peaceful protesters, which led to retaliatory violence that claimed nine lives and caused widespread destruction.

316.title: It was a joke: Bella on rumours that she blacked out because of her corset
316.article_body: In a recent Instagram story, Bella Hadid reacted to the rumours of her blacking out at the Met Gala because she couldn't breathe in her corset. "I didn't say I blacked out because of my corset," she said. "I joked that I blacked out, not because of my corset but from the...anxieties and excitement of the carpet," she added.

317.title: 1 million people have moved to simple, better banking: Jupiter
317.article_body: We've opened one million bank accounts since August 2021, revealed Jupiter—a 100% digital banking app. Millennials love the 1% rewards on all their spends*, personalized Insights on expenses, nudges to save more in Pots, and seeing all their bank accounts in one place, the company announced. They say we've made banking online as easy as ordering food online, added Jupiter.

318.title: Ashwin played his role to perfection against DC: Mohammad Kaif
318.article_body: Former Indian cricketer Mohammad Kaif has praised RR's Ravichandran Ashwin for his performance against DC, stating that the all-rounder performed his role to perfection. "It was not easy to bat because the ball was stopping on the pitch," added Kaif. Batting at the number three position, Ashwin scored 50 off 38 balls to help RR post 160/6.

319.title: Indians going abroad can take precaution COVID dose as per destination nation's rules
319.article_body: Union Health Minister Dr Mansukh Mandaviya on Thursday announced that Indian citizens and students travelling overseas can now take the precaution dose of COVID-19 vaccine as required by the guidelines of the destination country. "This new facility will be available soon on the CoWIN portal," he added. Earlier, all citizens above 18 were declared eligible for precaution dose.

320.title: Germany may be able to do without Russian gas next winter: Minister
320.article_body: German Economy Minister Robert Habeck said Germany may be able to make it through the next winter without Russian gas. "If we've full storage facilities at the turn of the year, if two of...four floating LNG tankers we've leased are connected to the grid and if we make significant energy savings, we can to some extent get through...winter," Habeck said.

321.title: Ponting backed Rishabh Pant ahead of Shreyas Iyer: Ajay Jadeja
321.article_body: Talking about DC's performance in the ongoing IPL season, ex-India cricketer Ajay Jadeja said Rishabh Pant has been good with the captaincy. "At times, when someone is made captain, you can feel that someone's guiding them. But with Pant, it's clear that he is the one calling the shots. Ricky Ponting backed Pant ahead of ex-captain Shreyas Iyer," he added.

322.title: Internet services restored in Raj's Bhilwara 2 days after 22-yr-old's death
322.article_body: The internet services have been restored in Rajasthan's Bhilwara, two days after a 22-year-old man was stabbed to death in Kotwali Police Station area. The District Magistrate on Thursday said that the situation is peaceful and appealed to the public not to pay heed to rumours. The internet services were suspended after tension escalated in Bhilwara following the man's death.

323.title: Bengaluru records lowest maximum temperature in May in 10 years
323.article_body: Bengaluru on Wednesday recorded a maximum temperature of 24.3°C, the lowest in the month of May in the last 10 years, according to the India Meteorological Department (IMD). The temperature on May 11 was nine degrees below the normal maximum temperature. The previous lowest maximum temperature recorded in the city in the last decade was 33.8°C on May 2, 2015.

324.title: Can't force these things: Sharmila on working with daughter-in-law Kareena
324.article_body: When asked about working with her daughter-in-law, actress Kareena Kapoor in future, veteran actress Sharmila Tagore said, "It's best if it happens organically, rather than being forced." She added that the audience would like to see a well-made film at the end of the day. "We're all a family of working actors and we all enjoy our work," Sharmila said.

325.title: Meta tells Reality Labs staff it's planning cutbacks in the divison
325.article_body: Meta has told its Reality Labs employees that it's planning cutbacks in the division. Chief Technology Officer Andrew Bosworth informed Reality Labs staffers to expect certain changes and that the division could not afford to do some projects anymore and would have to postpone others. A Meta spokesperson said the firm was not planning layoffs as part of the changes.

326.title: Action taken against encroachment not based on religion: Naqvi
326.article_body: Union Minister Mukhtar Abbas Naqvi on Wednesday, while talking about the anti-encroachment drive in Delhi, said action taken against encroachment is not based upon religion. "Action will be taken against whosoever is committing...crime, be it Congress or Mehbooba Mufti," Naqvi added. His remarks came following PDP chief Mehbooba Mufti's comments who said minorities are being targeted in the drive.

327.title: What we talked was personal, not even my brothers know about it: Rizwan on chat with Kohli
327.article_body: On being asked about his interaction with Virat Kohli after Pakistan's win against India in T20 World Cup 2021, Pakistan wicketkeeper-batter Muhammad Rizwan said, "What we talked was personal." He added, "At my home, not even my brothers know about it." Rizwan further said that he would pray for Kohli as the ex-India captain is going through a tough phase.

328.title: Rajiv Kumar appointed next Chief Election Commissioner, to replace Sushil Chandra
328.article_body: President Ram Nath Kovind has appointed Rajiv Kumar as the next Chief Election Commissioner of India. The announcement was made by Union Minister of Law and Justice Kiren Rijiju on Twitter. Rajeev Kumar will replace Sushil Chandra and assume the charge of the office from May 15.

329.title: Man rapes 23-yr-old woman and kills her, later rapes her dead body in Telangana
329.article_body: A 25-year old man raped a 23-year-old woman, beat her to death and then raped her corpse in Telangana. The incident took place in Choutuppal town. "We took up the investigation and using dog squads and other evidence collected from the spot, we managed to track down the suspect within 24 hours. After interrogation, we arrested him," police said.

330.title: Umran capable of playing int'l cricket, his 90% deliveries are 145 kmph: Steyn
330.article_body: Former South Africa pacer Dale Steyn has termed SRH pacer Umran Malik an "all-out fast bowler", who is capable of playing international cricket. Steyn added, "How India uses Umran is up to them...[but] one guy bowling 150 kmph consistently, I think every international team will want him. How and where you use him is critical," Steyn.

331.title: Day to reiterate appreciation: PM on International Nurses Day
331.article_body: On the occasion of the International Nurses Day, Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Thursday said that nurses play a vital role in keeping our planet healthy. "International Nurses Day is a day to reiterate our appreciation for all nursing staff for their exceptional work even in the most challenging of situations," PM tweeted.

332.title: Finland, which shares 1,300 km border with Russia, announces bid to join NATO
332.article_body: Amid Russia's invasion of Ukraine, Finland's President Sauli Niinisto and Prime Minister Sanna Marin on Thursday said that the country should apply to join NATO "without delay". Finland shares a 1,300 km border with Russia. Finland stepped up its cooperation with the North Atlantic Treaty Organisation as a partner since Russia annexed Crimea in 2014.

333.title: Burial sites found at 53 Native American boarding schools in US
333.article_body: A US government investigation into the history of Native American boarding schools has found "marked or unmarked burial sites" at 53 of them, Interior Secretary Deb Haaland said. Many children were abused at the schools, and tens of thousands were never heard from again, activists say. The report noted "rampant physical, sexual, and emotional abuse" took place at the schools.

334.title: Law Minister has no authority to draw any arbitrary 'Laxman Rekha': Chidambaram
334.article_body: Congress leader P Chidambaram reacted to Law Minister Kiren Rijiju’s "Laxman Rekha" remark made after the Supreme Court ordered to put the sedition law on hold. Rijiju had said, "There’s a 'Laxman Rekha' that must be respected by all organs of the state." Reacting to this, Chidambaram said the Law Minister has no authority to draw any “arbitrary Laxman Rekha”.

335.title: 'Chintan shivir' to discuss ways to re-energise Congress: Sachin Pilot
335.article_body: Congress leader Sachin Pilot said the Congress will deliberate on ways to re-energise the party and challenge the BJP-led NDA government in the 'Nav Sankalp Chintan Shivir' to be held in Udaipur. "The Nav Sankalp Chintan Shivir in Udaipur will prove to be very important in deciding the future strategy…This conference will be result and outcome-oriented," Pilot added.

336.title: K'taka Congress asked leaders, volunteers to troll me: Ex-MP Divya
336.article_body: Former MP Divya Spandana, who previously served as Congress' social media head, accused the party's Karnataka leadership of asking leaders and volunteers to troll her. "So the 'office' has circulated these messages among the Congress leaders and volunteers asking them [to] troll me," she tweeted. She later clarified that by "office" she meant Karnataka Congress under KPCC chief DK Shivakumar.

337.title: Vacate illegally occupied govt land or face action: Punjab CM Mann
337.article_body: Punjab CM Bhagwant Mann on Wednesday asked people illegally occupying government or panchayat land to vacate and hand the same over to authorities by May 31. He further warned of taking action against violators if such land is not voluntarily surrendered. According to Mann, the government has set a target of freeing 5,000 acres of illegally occupied land by month-end.

338.title: 39 violators nabbed for power theft in Ludhiana, ₹13.8 lakh fine collected
338.article_body: The Enforcement Wing of the Punjab State Power Corporation Limited on Wednesday conducted raids in Ludhiana and nabbed 39 persons for power theft. The Enforcement Wing fined the violators a total of around ₹13.8 lakh. Seven enforcement squads along with local police teams raided residential areas including Nandpur and Natt. "Repeated offenders will be put behind bars," an official said.

339.title: 37-year-old farmer gored to death by stray bull in UP's Agra
339.article_body: A 37-year-old farmer, Jitendra Baghel, was gored to death in a field by a stray bull in Uttar Pradesh's Agra. The bull attacked him while he was trying to keep his melon field safe from stray cattle. The bull reportedly tossed him in the air multiple times. His dead body was later discovered in the field by the villagers.

340.title: Ukraine offers to swap Russian prisoners for injured fighters
340.article_body: Ukraine has offered to release Russian prisoners of war in exchange for the evacuation of severely injured Ukrainian fighters trapped inside the Azovstal steel plant in Mariupol, the last remaining pocket of Ukrainian resistance in the city. Ukraine's Deputy PM Iryna Vereshchuk said negotiations are underway regarding the proposal. The Azovstal fighters have refused to surrender to Russian forces.

341.title: Schemes not just on paper: PM Modi hails Bharuch's Utkarsh Initiative
341.article_body: PM Narendra Modi on Thursday lauded the 'Utkarsh Initiative' by Gujarat's Bharuch district, under which financial assistance was provided to widows, elderly and destitute citizens. "Sometimes the schemes remain only on paper. But when the intention is clear, the policy is clear…there is a spirit of development for all, then we see results," said PM Modi in a virtual address.

342.title: People raise slogans ahead of demolition drive in Delhi's Madanpur Khadar
342.article_body: People on Thursday protested against the anti-encroachment drive in Delhi's Madanpur Khadar ward and raised slogans ahead of the drive. The drive was announced by the civic body. AAP's Amanatullah Khan, who is present at the location said, "I'm ready to go to jail if it saves poor people's houses." Anti-encroachment drive also took place at Rohini's KN Katju Marg.

343.title: Nobody cares for your story till you win: Sanjay Dutt on pic from gym
343.article_body: Actor Sanjay Dutt took to social media to share a picture of himself from a workout session, with the caption, "Nobody cares about your story till you win, so win!" "Baba you are always [a] winner, one will need 1000 guts to face what you have faced. You are...[an] inspiration to many," read a reaction on Twitter from a fan.

344.title: Inter-state drug racket busted in Hyderabad, 358 kg marijuana seized
344.article_body: Police arrested two inter-state drug peddlers in Hyderabad and seized 358 kilograms of marijuana from their possession. "They procured marijuana in dry form from Andhra Pradesh's Maredumilli at low rates and sold it at higher rates," police said. "They purchased each kilogram for ₹3,000 and planned to smuggle it to Mumbai to sell at ₹20,000 per kilogram," police added.

345.title: CSK unfollow Ravindra Jadeja on Instagram, CEO denies rumours of rift
345.article_body: CSK unfollowed Ravindra Jadeja on Instagram, sparking rumours of a rift. Following this, CSK CEO Kasi Viswanathan told The Indian Express, "I've no knowledge of what's going on there." Rubbishing rift rumours, he added, "What I can tell you is that from the management side, there has been no problem and whatever is there on social media, I'm not aware."

346.title: Coinbase's bankruptcy could put customer assets at risk: Zerodha CEO
346.article_body: Zerodha CEO Nithin Kamath while discussing Coinbase's latest filing cautioned Indian investors and said, "Customer assets could be at risk in case of bankruptcy." "Indian crypto investors on exchanges also need to be aware of this. Unlike...stock market where stocks are held in a Demat...crypto with exchanges carry a risk," he added. Coinbase, however, has denied facing bankruptcy risk.

347.title: To each his own: Suniel Shetty on actors being questioned for endorsing tobacco products
347.article_body: Talking about actors being questioned for endorsing tobacco products, Suniel Shetty said, "To each his own...Alcohol and tobacco get sold...which is why they're advertised." He added, "Those who don't want to consume it should refrain from doing so." Adding that he doesn't consume tobacco, Suniel said, "That doesn't mean I'm a saint...I won't say I'm right and others are wrong."

348.title: 24-yr-old man attacks fruit-seller with knife in Delhi, arrested
