348.article_body: A 24-year-old man was arrested for allegedly attacking a fruit-seller with a knife in Delhi's Prashant Vihar area, police said. The accused, who is also a fruit-seller, reportedly attacked Sonu Kumar over some previous enmity. On Monday, an altercation broke out between the two, following which the accused attacked Kumar with a knife used to cut coconut, police said.

349.title: I went on 50 dates in 2019, I was 39: 'Jojo Rabbit' actress Rebel Wilson
349.article_body: Australian actress Rebel Wilson who starred in Oscar-nominated film 'Jojo Rabbit' said she went on 50 dates in 2019 at the age of 39. "I went on some dates with...billionaires and then also some people who had nothing," added Wilson. "The last person I went out with...I did get the FBI to...check them out," stated Wilson.

350.title: Massive fire in canteen stirs panic at UP's Moradabad railway station
350.article_body: A major fire broke out at a canteen on platform number 5 of Moradabad railway station at 2:30 am on Thursday. This triggered panic among people and they started running in all directions, police said. Fire brigade was, however, sent immediately to the spot. No casualties were reported in the fire suspected to be caused due to loose wires.

351.title: After injury, COVID, I felt I was batting with the wrong end of my bat: Marsh
351.article_body: Speaking about how he struggled to find rhythm due to an injury and then testing positive for COVID-19 in IPL 2022, DC all-rounder Mitchell Marsh said, "I felt I was batting with the wrong end of my bat." Marsh was named Man of the Match for his performance against RR on Wednesday. The 30-year-old picked two wickets and scored 89(62).

352.title: UK pledges military help to Sweden & Finland if attacked
352.article_body: The UK has signed security deals with Sweden and Finland, agreeing to come to their aid, including with military support, if either nation comes under attack. UK PM Boris Johnson visited both Nordic nations to sign the pacts amid debate about them joining NATO. Russia has warned of "military and political repercussions" if Sweden and Finland decide to join NATO.

353.title: Delhi HC judge asks is it rape if husband forces wife for sex, MP Priyanka replies
353.article_body: Hearing marital rape case in Delhi High Court, Justice C Hari Shankar said, "A husband may, on occasion, compel his wife to have sex...Can it be said...her experience is the same as that of a woman who is ravaged by stranger?" MP Priyanka Chaturvedi tweeted, "The experience of outrage, disrespect and violation is just as strong. Ask women around you."

354.title: 5 from Maharashtra die after vehicle rams into truck on Yamuna Expressway
354.article_body: At least five persons from Maharashtra, including four women, were killed and two got injured after the vehicle they were travelling in rammed into a truck on Yamuna Expressway, police said. They were declared brought dead after they were rushed to a hospital, police added.  The police suspect that the accident happened after the driver of the vehicle fell asleep.

355.title: UK PM trolled after pic of him wearing full suit while rowing a boat goes viral
355.article_body: UK Prime Minister Boris Johnson was trolled after a picture of him wearing full suit while rowing a boat went viral on social media. Johnson was accompanied by Swedish Prime Minister Magdalena Andersson. Reacting to the picture, a social media user wrote, "Boris Johnson is like 'I've rowed in suits all my life and I'm gonna be alright'."

356.title: For me, my dad is my God; I will not act in his biopic: Mahesh Babu on father
356.article_body: Actor Mahesh Babu said that for him, his father Krishna is God and that he will never act in his biopic. "I would rather love to produce if the subject can be dealt properly," he added. Meanwhile, Mahesh Babu had recently said that he doesn't want to waste his time in Bollywood as the industry can't afford him.

357.title: I've had a really s***ty time: Camila Cabello on body image issues
357.article_body: Singer Camila Cabello spoke about her "ever-present struggle" with body image under the limelight of being a celebrity. "People...often look at these pictures of celebrities and want to change their diet or aspire to that," Camila said. "I might look a certain way but I've had a really s***ty time and that's not a good way to be," she added.

358.title: Postpone NEET PG 2022 scheduled for May 21: IMA to Health Minister
358.article_body: The Indian Medical Association (IMA) on Wednesday wrote a letter to Union Health Minister Mansukh Mandaviya requesting him to postpone the NEET PG 2022, which is scheduled to be held on May 21. It said that the aspirants have been given very little time to prepare for the exam owing to the delay in last year's exam and counselling.

359.title: Railway station near Somnath temple to be redeveloped at ₹134 cr
359.article_body: The Rail Land Development Authority (RLDA) has decided to redevelop the railway station near Somnath temple in Gujarat at an estimated cost of ₹134 crore. "The upgradation...will strengthen tourism prospects of the area," stated RLDA vice-chairman. The proposed upgradation will include civil work along with an exclusive building façade exhibiting local heritage of Somnath temple.

360.title: No need to panic: K'taka Health Minister on reports of tomato flu in Kerala
360.article_body: Karnataka Health Minister Dr K Sudhakar has asked people not to panic on reports of tomato flu in the neighbouring state and said, "It is endemic to Kerala." He added that the authorities in border districts have been instructed to remain alert about controlling its spread. Tomato flu has been reported in over 80 children aged below five in Kerala.

361.title: 47-yr-old woman missing for 2 days found dead near society stairs in Noida
361.article_body: A 47-year-old woman, who went missing on Monday, was found dead near the staircase leading to her apartment in Noida’s Sector 137 on Wednesday. "The cause of death is termed as shock and haemorrhage," police said. The woman had earlier gone missing on May 5 too, however, her family traced her to Ranikhet and brought her back, police added.

362.title: Half of households in India do not seek govt health care: NFHS
362.article_body: Half of the households in India do not usually seek healthcare from government health facilities, according to the National Family Health Survey (NFHS-5). Almost half of them do not do so because of the "poor quality of care" at public hospitals. During 2019-21, 49.9% of households did not generally use a government health facility, according to the survey.

363.title: Rupee hits new all-time low, slips to 77.55 against US dollar
363.article_body: The Indian rupee has touched a fresh all-time low of 77.55 against the US dollar. The rupee slumped 30 paise in opening trade as a lacklustre trend in the domestic equity markets and a firm American currency weighed on investor sentiment, reports said. Besides, persistent foreign fund outflows and elevated crude oil prices impacted the domestic unit, forex traders said.

364.title: There is a big question mark on Kieron Pollard's form: Parthiv
364.article_body: Ex-India player Parthiv Patel has said MI all-rounder Kieron Pollard's form is the only point of concern for MI ahead of their match against CSK on Thursday. "There is a big question mark on Pollard's form and the way he is approaching the game," he added. So far, Pollard has scored 144 runs from his 11 games this season.

365.title: Rise in locals turning terrorists in J&K in last 2 years: Report
365.article_body: The number of local youngsters to join terrorist ranks in Jammu and Kashmir has increased significantly in the last two years, said a report citing CRPF sources. The share of local terrorists in the union territory has been as high as 60% over these years, it said. Earlier, foreign terrorists, mainly Pakistanis, constituted about 60-70% of the total, said officials.

366.title: Siemens announces exit from Russian market, condemns Ukrainian war
366.article_body: German multinational conglomerate Siemens will quit the Russian market due to the war in Ukraine. "We join the international community in condemning the war in Ukraine and are focused on supporting our people and providing humanitarian aid," CEO Roland Busch said. Siemens reportedly employs around 3,000 people in Russia and had earlier decided not to take on new projects there.

367.title: 'Honey-trapped' IAF jawan arrested for espionage in Delhi; ISI involvement suspected
367.article_body: Delhi Police Crime Branch have arrested IAF jawan Devendra Sharma on espionage charges, officials said, adding that they suspect he was 'honey-trapped'. Police said a woman befriended Sharma on Facebook and tried to get information about positions of IAF radars and posting of senior officials. Officers added they suspect the involvement of Pakistan's Inter-Services Intelligence (ISI) behind it.

368.title: Saudi Aramco dethrones Apple as world's most valuable company
368.article_body: World's biggest crude exporter Saudi Aramco has overtaken Apple as the world's most valuable company. The Saudi state-run oil company's market cap rose to $2.43 trillion on Wednesday after its shares surged due to higher oil prices. Meanwhile, Apple's market capitalisation fell to $2.37 trillion after its share price tanked 5.2% on Wednesday.

369.title: SRK is the 'original' gangster and occasionally acts like one: Ranveer
369.article_body: Actor Ranveer Singh said Shah Rukh Khan is the "original gangster" and occasionally "acts" like one. "He is the definition of a mobster," added Ranveer. "I can't wait to see him again since I adore and respect him so much," stated Ranveer. "He is a man of incomparable greatness...Shah Rukh Khan is the king for a reason," he said.

370.title: Chronological tweets are better than what algorithm suggests: Musk
370.article_body: Tesla CEO Elon Musk took to Twitter to say, "Chronological tweets seem much better than what 'the algorithm' suggests." He also asked users to tap on stars present in the upper right corner of their home page to revert to chronological order. Responding to Musk, Twitter Co-founder Jack Dorsey said, "This is the way...Having [a] choice is the most important."

371.title: VHP leader injured in clash in Rajasthan's Hanumangarh, internet services suspended
371.article_body: A Vishva Hindu Parishad (VHP) leader was injured after a clash broke out between two groups on Wednesday evening in Nohar city of Rajasthan's Hanumangarh, police said. Following the clash, the district administration suspended internet services in Nohar, Bhadra and Rawatsar towns in Hanumangarh. The attack on the VHP leader took place when he tried to stop eve-teasers, police said.

372.title: Love the boy, I'd like them to take decision: Suniel on Rahul, Athiya's wedding
372.article_body: Actor Suniel Shetty said that he loves daughter Athiya Shetty's boyfriend KL Rahul. While talking about their marriage, he added, "It is for them to decide what they want to do, because times have changed. Both my son and daughter are responsible people. I would like them to take the decision. My blessings are always there for them."

373.title: Greece bans LGBTQ conversion therapy for minors
373.article_body: Greece on Wednesday banned LGBTQ conversion therapy for minors. Under the bill, which the Greek Parliament approved, psychologists or any other health professionals will require an individual's explicit consent to perform such treatment and would face fines and a prison term if they violate the law. Earlier this year, Canada, New Zealand, and France criminalised LGBTQ conversion therapy.

374.title: Masaba celebrates dad Vivian Richards' 70th b'day in Antigua, shares post
374.article_body: Fashion designer Masaba Gupta celebrated her father, former cricketer Vivian Richards' 70th birthday on Wednesday. Taking to Instagram, she shared pictures from his birthday celebration as they organised a charity tournament to aid healthcare workers. Alongside the post, she wrote, "To celebrate dad's 70th birthday in Antigua, a golf tournament (where he is happiest after a cricket field)."

375.title: COVID-19 death toll in US crosses 10 lakh
375.article_body: Over two years into the pandemic, COVID-19 has now claimed more than 10 lakh lives in the US, according to Reuters. The data shows one out of every 327 Americans died of the infection. The toll had surpassed the number of US' military deaths in World War I by June 2020 and that of World War II by January 2021.

376.title: BJP leaders using CAA as carrot on stick: TMC’s Abhishek Banerjee
376.article_body: TMC National General Secretary Abhishek Banerjee said BJP leaders are using the Citizenship Amendment Act (CAA) as a "carrot" on a stick. "CAA is a political tool and we should not get into this trap," Banerjee said in Assam. He added that Union Home Minister Amit Shah maintained silence over the CAA and NRC during his two-day visit to Assam.

377.title: Rajasthan govt has no right to continue, it’s 'anti-people': Nadda
377.article_body: BJP National President JP Nadda on Wednesday said an "anti-people" government is in power in Rajasthan that does not understand the issues of the people. The government in the state has no right to continue in power, Nadda added. Rajasthan has the highest number of rape cases in the country but the CM is not concerned, Nadda stated.

378.title: List of 10 highest-paid sportspersons released by Forbes
378.article_body: Argentina and PSG forward Lionel Messi was the highest-paid sportsperson over the past year with earnings of $130 million, as per Forbes' list of 10 highest-paid sportspersons. It is the second time that Messi has topped the list. He is followed by LeBron James ($121.2 million) and Cristiano Ronaldo ($115 million)

379.title: Whose pressure will he have: Kangana on Big B deleting tweet promoting 'Dhaakad'
379.article_body: Reacting to Amitabh Bachchan posting a tweet promoting her upcoming movie 'Dhaakad' and deleting it after a while, actress Kangana Ranaut said that it is "so striking". "At somebody of his stature, at his level, whose pressure will he have?" Kangana added. "I find this situation a bit complex," the actress further said.

380.title: 22 people jailed for 2021 temple attack in Pak over 8-yr-old boy urinating in madrasa
380.article_body: A Pakistani anti-terrorism court on Wednesday sentenced 22 people to five years in jail each for attacking a temple in Punjab province last year. A mob had attacked the temple after an 8-year-old boy allegedly urinated in the library of a madrasa. The court acquitted 62 people, giving them a benefit of doubt, a court official said.

381.title: Had a few practice games where I opened also: Ashwin on batting at no. 3
381.article_body: RR all-rounder Ravichandran Ashwin, who has now batted thrice at the number three position in IPL 2022, has revealed that the management had "communicated properly" that they would be using him up the order at the start of the season. "We had a few practice games where I opened  [also]," he added. Ashwin scored 50(38) against DC on Wednesday.

382.title: UP Police constable arrested for supplying drugs in Mumbai
382.article_body: Mumbai Police recently arrested a constable of Uttar Pradesh Police force for allegedly being a part of a gang smuggling Double Tiger Mark Heroin and Mephedrone drugs in the city. The police had earlier arrested two people from Malad for smuggling drugs worth over ₹1.7 crore. During interrogation, they informed about their supplier attached to the UP Police, police added.

383.title: Intact fossil of pregnant ichthyosaur recovered from glacier in Chile
383.article_body: Scientists have recovered one of world's most complete ichthyosaur fossils with intact embryos from a glacier in Chile's Patagonia region. It's the "only pregnant ichthyosaur that's been found on the planet from the era between 129 and 139 million years ago", one of the scientists said. Scientists spent 31 days extracting the fossil, which was found over a decade ago.

384.title: Shiv Sena MLA Ramesh Latke dies aged 52 during family vacation in Dubai
384.article_body: Shiv Sena MLA from Mumbai's Andheri East Ramesh Latke died of a cardiac arrest aged 52 in Dubai, a party official said. "He had gone to Dubai with his family on a vacation," the official added. "We've informed CM Uddhav Thackeray and other senior party leaders about initiating the procedure to bring his body back to India," the official stated.

385.title: When I got back, they wanted me to play mother of heroes 3 yrs younger: Sarika
385.article_body: Actress Sarika said that when she returned back to acting, she was offered roles of a mother. "They wanted me to play mother to heroes who were three years younger than me," she said, adding that ageism, when it comes to roles for female actors, is still there and that it is not something that can be changed.

386.title: The days when nothing else but love mattered are gone: Arshad Warsi
386.article_body: Actor Arshad Warsi said modern love is more practical than it should be, adding that it has crossed the line of a true feeling. "It is not just pure love. The days when nothing else but love mattered are gone," stated Arshad. "There has to be a reason and other things apart from just love," said Arshad.

387.title: Navi Mumbai Muslim group installs sound control units in city mosques
387.article_body: The Muslim community in Navi Mumbai launched an initiative to install sound control units in the city mosques on Wednesday. The community will first distribute 50 units to the mosques and 100 more would be added later. These units will ensure that the volume of azaan in the mosques is within the permissible decibel limit stipulated by the Supreme Court.

388.title: 2 booked for cheating carpet godown owner of ₹3.65 lakh in Pune
388.article_body: A case has been registered against a man and a woman for cheating a carpet business owner of ₹3.65 lakh by providing him forged property tax receipts in Pune. The 56-year-old man had reportedly approached the accused as he did not know the workings of the Pune Municipal Corporation (PMC). The money was transferred between August 2021 and October 2021.

389.title: One booked for taking Maha MP Navneet Rana's photos during her MRI scan
389.article_body: Mumbai's Bandra Police booked an unknown person who clicked photographs of Maharashtra's Amravati MP Navneet Rana during her MRI scan on May 6. "He further gave the photos to the media...made them viral on social media," the complainant, a security supervisor with the Lilavati Hospital, said. Rana was admitted to the hospital after she was released from Byculla jail.

390.title: Not cut out for Bombay if you don't have work in today's age: Aparshakti
390.article_body: Sharing his opinion on opportunities available due to OTT, actor Aparshakti Khurana said, "OTT has given...much liberty. Actors who don't have work in today's age are not cut out for Bombay or this industry." "There is something wrong with their reality check whether they have it in them," added Aparshakti. "There's some problem with their intent to work," stated Aparshakti.

391.title: Ukrainian soldiers reach Germany for 40-day howitzer training
391.article_body: More than 60 Ukrainian soldiers have reportedly arrived in Germany to get training in using howitzers. The training, which will be conducted at a German military's artillery school in Rhineland-Palatinate state, is expected to last around 40 days. The Ukrainian soldiers were flown into Germany from Poland on Tuesday. This comes amid Ukraine's ongoing war with Russia.

392.title: I'll never be Twitter CEO again: Co-founder Jack Dorsey
392.article_body: Twitter Co-founder and former CEO Jack Dorsey, in response to a tweet saying Elon Musk will eventually ask him to be the CEO, said, "Nah I'll never be CEO again." On being asked if he would like such a prospect, Dorsey said, "Nah. It's time to roll the dice again." He also said no one should be Twitter's CEO ultimately.

393.title: Used to be cagey about expressing myself, felt judged: Ranveer on his costumes
393.article_body: Discussing his dressing sense and costumes, actor Ranveer Singh said, "I used to feel cagey [and judged] about expressing myself. I would alter my way of being in accordance with the effects those judgements were having." "At one point I let that go. I was like, people are gonna judge anyway so...dress the way you want," added Ranveer.

394.title: Ratna didi & I fought about clothes but never about sharing space: Supriya
394.article_body: Actress Supriya Pathak said that she and her sister, actress Ratna Pathak Shah shared a room while growing up. "We fought about everything but never about sharing space. Since there was no other room that we could go to after a fight, we had to stick together," she added. "Ratna didi and I've had huge fights about clothes," Supriya said.

395.title: Fan stalked mom, said 'want to be daughter-in-law, I'll sweep house': Kartik
395.article_body: Actor Kartik Aaryan said that a female fan had started stalking his mother and started sending her messages on Instagram. Kartik said that the fan said that she wants to be his mother's daughter-in-law. "[She said] I will even sweep your house," he added. He mentioned that the incident took place recently.

396.title: TMC to reach all parts of Assam by end of 2022: Abhishek Banerjee
396.article_body: TMC's Abhishek Banerjee said that by the end of 2022, the party will have an office at booth-level in all parts of Assam. "Every like-minded party which wants to defeat the BJP (in Assam), we invite them to join us for a combined fight," Banerjee added. "We are here because we are concerned about issues in Assam," Banerjee stated.

397.title: Ukraine commander asks Musk for help, tweets 'People say you come from another planet'
397.article_body: The commander of a Ukrainian Marine Brigade has appealed to Elon Musk to help soldiers escape a steel plant besieged by Russian forces in Mariupol. Major Serhiy Volyna tweeted, "Elon Musk, people say you come from another planet to teach people to believe in the impossible...Help us get out of Azovstal...If not you, then who? Give me a hint."

398.title: India reports 2,827 new COVID-19 cases, 24 deaths in 24 hours
398.article_body: India has reported 2,827 COVID-19 cases, 3,230 recoveries and 24 deaths in the last 24 hours, according to the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare. This comes a day after the country saw 2,897 COVID-19 cases and 54 deaths. Active cases in India stand at 19,067, while the death toll has risen to 5,24,181.

399.title: Google unveils new 10-shade skin tone scale to address bias in products
399.article_body: Google unveiled a new 10-shade skin tone palette at its I/O developer conference that it's incorporating into several of its products over the coming months. The Monk Skin Tone Scale is designed to replace outdated skin tone scales that are biased towards lighter skin. Beauty-related Google Images searches such as 'bridal makeup looks' now allow filtering results based on Monk.

400.title: Man accused of brandishing sword during Khargone violence in MP held
400.article_body: Police on Wednesday arrested a man, identified as Irfan, who had allegedly brandished a sword during Khargone violence on Ram Navami in Madhya Pradesh. Notably, the man was chased by the Superintendent of Police (SP) but had managed to escape from the spot, an official said. Irfan's accomplice had fired at the SP leaving him injured, the official added.

401.title: BJP MLA, 25 others get 2 yrs rigorous imprisonment for gambling in Guj
401.article_body: A court in Gujarat's Halol sentenced BJP MLA Kesarisinh Solanki and 25 others, including seven women to two years of rigorous imprisonment in a gambling case. All the convicts were arrested while gambling during a raid at Jimira Resort at Shivrajpur village on July 3, 2021. Convicting the MLA, the court said, "If he is shown...leniency...it'll...send out a wrong message."

402.title: BMC launches 'Safe School' project to make roads near schools safe for kids
402.article_body: Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC) on Wednesday launched 'Safe School' project to make roads and footpaths around the periphery of schools in Mumbai safe for children. "As part of...project, we'll reengineer footpaths outside schools and paint road markings and zebra crossings using bright colours," an official said. Existing furniture on footpaths will also be revamped, the official added.

403.title: Anushka Sharma praises Virat Kohli for laughing at jokes about his bad form in interview
403.article_body: Actress Anushka Sharma took to her Instagram Stories to praise her husband, RCB batter Virat Kohli, for laughing at jokes about his bad form in a recent interview. Anushka wrote, "If you cannot laugh at yourself, you may be missing the colossal joke of the century." Kohli was seen laughing when the interviewer asked him about his "pet ducks".
